6.8 The Perfectionism Objection

Liberal perfectionists claim that the state should promote the
authentic human good. They reject public justification for preventing
governments from promoting that good. And they reject the ideas of
“neutrality” and “restraint” that justify the
PJP. (Wall 1998, Chan 2000.) For some prominent replies, see Quong
2011. Perfectionists reject the PJP itself, not merely some
interpretations of it.
